Hi there, This feedback is incomplete and not really useable by our team in its current form. Can you explain what you're looking for - does this have an effect? If so, what? Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way.
When you get close to  someone there is an option to jump on a players   Head
Yes but why? (Seriously this is going to be the first question we get from the team.)
For some reason I think this is a really good idea, and maybe it would cause damage to them.
Yes that’s right; you would jump as a form of attack on each other, rather than hitting.

We could jump on a player if they are crouching, and press alt to grab them/ pull them up.

This could also work on other mobs, and doing it would give you the "Gimme a Boost" advancement.

An update focused on polishing the game is exactly what MineCraft needs. In my experience with the game, there seems to be a lot of new content that's just pushed out and builds hype. Yet when it actually reaches the game it's often overly niche and ends up forgotten. A major issue that needs overhauling comes with the movement and pathfinding of most mobs, goats are cool and all but when you try to lead them back to your home they often get stuck and this is the case with both rabbits (who get stuck on simple 1-block jumps) and llamas (attempting to move a caravan is so difficult that it's not worth it). A secondary issue I have is that some features become so rare and niche that they basically don't affect the game in any way, this is prominent with things like the trident where you need to grind drowned for ages only to get a near broken one. At that point in the game you are likely to have gear far better than the trident even with maximum enchantments. There is also the furnace minecart, I love this thing. The idea of allowing rail travel earlier in the game without requiring overly large amounts of gold is effectively balanced by the fuel cost, the major issue being that it is absolutely busted. So broken in fact that if it hits a simple slope or bend in the track it makes a mess of your beautiful train. Yet another issue is farming that is reliant on bone meal, this applies mostly to crimson/warped fungus. They are cool wood types, but why not farm it normally?

An update where the game is improved on will be nice.
No new blocks or mobs but only improving the current things in-game.
This would be great improving the graphics and everything in the game
Finally Sniffer won mobvote 2022 I will wait for update 1.20 and SNIFFER in minecraft

If anyone else has any other ideas for a possible farming overhaul, feel free to post them here.

Expounding on how crops are grown. Carrots and potatoes for example really couldn't care less about how many nutrients are in the soil they grow in. In fact, they like it sandy and sad. So, firstly, you shouldn't be able to bonemeal them, and secondly, with the different soils idea, maybe they grow better in course dirt or something of that sort. We have the blocks to make growing crops more realistic/educational *wink*, just need to make them plowable.

And also, working how plants reproduce irl into the game a little more would be cool. For example, carrots are diurnal crops, they grow the first year, and then flower. So, while they are harvestable the first year, and you can replant the tops after you eat them to have them grow again (and then I think they flower, even if it's the same year)
But when you replant them, you only get as many carrots as tops as you replant, so you can't get more carrots that way.

So, easy solution, made better with a seasons update (perhaps in the same update) is to add another growth stage to plants that reproduce by flowering like carrots. If you want to increase how many carrots (or similar plant) you have, you have to wait the additional time for it to flower, and then you use, say shears, to get seeds, in this case, carrot seeds.

Of course, with potatoes, you can cut up one potato into wedges and replant it, getting more potatoes, so the current reproduction methods for some plants is perfectly fine
